heisig_chinese_memo: If you do it correct on attempt number one you can stop.
heisig_story: "A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step," says the Chinese proverb. Here we see one footprint, complementing that proverb with the sound advice that if the first step is not made correctly, the whole point of the journey will be forfeited. This is the ideal that teachers are supposed to have in correcting their students, and parents in correcting their children.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There is a line on the ground so you stop and a giant sign pops up that says CORRECT! You obeyed the rules of the road and did the correct thing.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine walking, staring at the ground until you come across a line that you're supposed to stop at. If you stop, the big "correct" sign appears, chiming a happy tune.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You did the correct thing, so the Shougun (ã—ã‚‡ã†) shows up to reward you! He holds out a shiny new saber (ã›ã„) in his hand, gently taps it onto each of your shoulders, and then hands it to you. It's big, curved and you love it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Being correct got the Shougun to notice you AND a new saber. You better make sure to answer this kanji correctly in your reviews too, so you can keep being correct and have more nice things happen.

origin_of_ch_char_book: When the weather becomes warm, it is convenient to wage war against another country. Therefore, the ancient Chinese used to call â€œa month favorable to invadeâ€ as â€œZheng Yue (=Cheng YÃ¼eh), æ­£æœˆâ€, which means lunar month of January in East Asia. â€œZheng Yueâ€ falls usually is in Feburary in the standard calendar year. (æ­£, zheng, correct) describes a person approaching a village or a fortress. It has on top, which implies the fences or the walls around a village or a fortress, and there is a character signifying foot under the word. . In the present time, this word means â€œcorrectâ€. But before then, it meant â€œto attackâ€. In the past, the purpose of the war was to correct the fault of some area. Therefore this character came to mean â€˜rightâ€™, â€˜exactâ€™.,Bronze WeaGrappling Hook used when attack the castle. (16th century- 11th century BC) (æ˜¯, shi, be; right) the sun rises above the horizon, and a foot (that stands for walking) goes forward (æ­£, zheng, correct). The sun was like a deity. Thus, this character means to do the â€˜rightâ€™ thing. Now it is used as â€˜yesâ€™, â€˜beâ€™.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jinwen starts from " stop " from " ding ", and " ding " is also a sound symbol (Xu Zaiguo, Liu Zhao). " Ding " indicates the goal or city of the itinerary, and the character image person uses " stop " (toe) to advance towards the goal, which is the initial text of " zheng ". The original meaning is a long journey, after more than used to indicate the correct, prejudiced the " positive ."

A gold inscription may be superimposed from the two " stop " under the word. In addition, the " Ding " from the " zheng " inscriptions of the Western Zhou Dynasty was either filled in as a dot or simplified as a horizontal painting. Spring and Autumn Bronze Inscriptions may be decorated with short horizontal lines, which have the same shape as "ã±" in the ancient text of " Shuowen ". "Guodian Jane. "Tang Yu Zhi Dao" Jane 3 may add the sound " Ding " to the word " Zheng ". "Said Wen": "True, yes. From the end, one to the end. All righteous are from the right. ã±, the ancient text is correct, from the second. Second, the ancient text is the word. ğ§¾¸, the ancient text is from the first foot. The foot also ends. and also."

The original meaning of " zheng " is to travel far, that is, the elephants use their toes (stop) to advance to a predetermined destination. Therefore, the original meanings of " zheng " and " zheng " were not fixed at the beginning of military crusades. National or country hunting can be called " zheng " (Wu Qichang). Only later generations tended to focus on his conquest righteousness. Since " zheng " is often used to express the meaning of correction and partiality, the word " zheng " (Qiu Xigui) is differentiated next to "å½³". See " Zheng ".

" Zheng " in the oracle bone inscriptions is pronounced " Zheng ", which means crusade, "Compilation" 6441: "Now Wang Zheng (Zheng) earthwork" means that the king is going to crusade earthwork. It is also used as the term of time, "Collection" 22723: "Only (in) the first month." The term "first month" is often seen in Oracle, which means the first month of the year. " Zheng " may be used as a place name. "He Ji" 22246: "Zheng Shou He" refers to receiving millet at a place called Zheng. Also used as a memorial name, "Collection" 14315 is: "Jing Zu Yi."

" Zheng " in the bronze inscription is pronounced as " zheng ", which means to conquer. Fang Ding: "Ji (Wei) Wang Zheng (Zheng) Jing Fang." There is also the word "Jiang Yue", which means the first month of the year. The gentleman's husband cover: "Only at the beginning of the first month, Ji Yihai." Chief, the five sacrifices of Wei Ding: "Zheng Nai (Nai) Xun Li", the whole sentence refers to the officer and then interrogates Li. Mao Gongding: "There is no righteousness (to hear), to quote (to) the only Wangzhi (to know)? It is to lose our country." The whole sentence means that even the ruler has not heard of it. Would the king know? So our country perishes. "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Zheng, Bo, Chang Ye." It is also pronounced " Politics ", referring to government orders, Da Yu Ding: "Yu Wen (wen) Wang Zheng (zheng) De." "Shi Ming. "Shi Yanyu": "politics, righteousness. The following is the righteousness." Another " zheng " also has the meaning of assessment, Shijun ğ£ª• Cover: "Wang ğ¢“Š (birth) Zhengshishi", refers to Wang examines Shishi.

" Zheng " means upright in the bamboo slips of the Warring States Period. "Jing Yi" Jane 2: "Quiet (Jing) é¾ (Gong) å°’ (Er) stand (position), ğ¡¥† (good) is Zheng Zhi (straight)", which means to take up your position properly and respectfully, and to get close to appoint integrity People. It is also used for " levying ", referring to taxation, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 36: "å°‚ (supplement) is a positive (levy) nationality, ã ¯ (to) is (to) off the city", refers to the auxiliary collection of taxes to levy taxes on people who pass through the customs. Also used as " politics ", referring to political affairs, "Guodian Jian. "Self-proclaimed" Jian 56-57: "Success to the monarch, the next to be close to the people (politics), you (cultivation) to be close to the benevolent." The full sentence refers to follow the morals and contact with the superior, that is, close to mastering and serving the monarch The way; follow morals to communicate with the next, can get the trust of everyone, and know how to handle government affairs properly; to cultivate one's morality is close to the achievement of benevolence.

Also called "î¦1".
(1) Among; not partial.
(2) Straight, not curved.
(3) Upright, not oblique or crooked.
(4) Integrity and decency.
(5) Fair and reasonable; not biased.
(6) Correct.
(7) Accurate and no deviation. See "Zhengzheng".
(8) Standards; Guidelines.
(9) In accordance with laws, laws or normal conditions.
(10) Neat. See "Zhengzheng".
(11) Pure one is not miscellaneous.
(12) Sincere.
(13) Formal; major.
(14) Just and serious.
(15) Refers to the front. Contrast with "back", "side" and "anti".
(16) Means that the length of each side of the figure and the size of each corner are equal.
(17) Serious and solemn.
(18) Make solemn and solemn.
(19) Distinguish right from wrong and judge right from wrong.
(20) Correction, correction. Refers to correcting things that are skewed or deviated or fallacy.
(21) It specifically refers to correcting violations of principles, standards or regulations in politics, morality, thought, speech, etiquette, etc.
(22) Governance.
(23) That is the punishment.
(24) Stop, stop.
(25) Ascend to the throne; take office.
(26) Decide; confirm.
